title: Opening Ceremony’s Summer 2017 Collection Blends Old School With Modern Details
text:
Visit the original post to see all 26 images from this gallery. 
Opening Ceremony unveils its Summer 2017 collection, which is inspired by the journeys of American immigrants. Particularly taking cues on traditions from the Baltic, the lineup of feminine silhouettes embody a blend based on folklore, alongside menswear details, ornate accents and embroideries with modern asymmetry.
Loose, airy pieces — chiffon maxi dresses, ruched cotton tees, and clean tops with fluttery sleeves – are core pieces of the range, which evoke a romantic, yet versatile aesthetic. Menswear elements are found on an off-shoulder dress and puff-sleeve cardigan featuring necklines inspired by French-cuff shirting, while an oversized hooded button-down and tank dress in silk jacquard, incorporates a diamond geometry borrowed from foulard neckties and handkerchiefs. In addition, an oxford-like top features panels of poplin stripes.
A standout detail consist of embroidery, inspired by Baltic textiles, are reinterpreted in geometric zigzag rather than its traditional floral makeup. Furthermore, reversible silk robes and kimono souvenir jackets featuring a spin of the OC logo are notable pieces.
Finally, a refreshed lineup of footwear with slides, such as the Paulyna and Natalija, come in black, white, and croc-embossed metallic leathers. The Nykola, a flatform clog returns in burnished silver, while low-heel sandals and the popular Cici slip-on is rendered in nude satin.
Blending a muted and crisp palette of sand, black, white, cantaloupe, pistachio, and sailor blue – the Opening Ceremony Summer 2017 collection is available starting today.
